result.execSummary:
The defendant Stewart L Herrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 946.41 Resisting or Obstructing Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stewart L Herrera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:54 AM. Also called 15CM38. Burns - resolved - offer attached to plea questionnaire - 15CM04 - joint recommendation that the defendant would be pleading to #1 as alleged, 5 days jail, $1379.00 fine inclusive, 12 month DL suspension, IID, AODA assessment; plead to #3 and #6 as alleged - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: court costs only on each count, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, tavrrns, liquor stores or establishments that sell alcohol, employment/school, 50 hours of community service, counts #2, #4 and #5 - DRI; 15CM38 - joint recommnendation to DRI counts #2 and #3 - amend #1 to county ordinance of obstructing with a forfeiture of $500 plus costs. State agrees - defendant needs to acknowledge one prior conviction of OWI and moves to amendments as stated by Burns. Herrara will plead NC to counts #1, #3 and #6 as alleged on 15CM04. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #4 and #5 on 15CM04. Court - 15CM38 - amends count #1 to county ordinance of obstructing - pleads NC - finds G - fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - take bond posted from this case and move bond from 15CM04 to pay this fine entirely and transfer remaining bond to 15CM04. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Burns acknowledges 1 prior OWI conviction. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Herrera makes statement - requests jail credit of 1 day on 15CM04 and 22 days on 15CM38 and apply that credit to 15CM04. State argues - no legal basis - will stipulate to 1 day credit on 15CM04. Court responds - does not believe it can apply the 22 days to 15CM04. Burns responds. Court will allow counsel the ability to research the jail credit and then asks for time to report while research is being completed. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM04 - count #1 - 5 days in FC jail - report by no later than 8:30 AM on 8/14/15 - 1 day credit - huber allowed, fine of $1379.00 inclusive of costs - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation on remaining counts, 12 month DL revocation, IID for 12 months on DL and any vehicle titled in his name, AODA; counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year - concurrent to each other, with conditions of: costs on each count - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns beer tents or establishments that sell alcohol, maintain full time employment, 50 hours of community service total, DNA surcharge on both counts - paid thru probation, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 1:44 PM. Burns has both complaints, waives reading of them and enters NG pleas to all counts. court continues bond, accepts pleas, set both matters for FPT.

ADDRESS INFO for Stewart L Herrera
Current: P.O. Box 91, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 04-28-2015)
Prior: 5592 Kwe Da Kik Court, Crandon, WI 54520

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Called 10:00 am. Attorney Mary Burns appears on behalf of defendant. No appearance by Herrera. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns provides court with "request for substitution". Court accepts substitution.

Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court with attorney Jeffery Joy appears telephonically.  Defendant Stewart L Herrera in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:53 PM. Also called 15CM38. Herrera thought he had SPD representation. Joy responds, thought he was going to be privately retained. Mary Burns was here from SPD. Court instructs defendant to contact SPD and Ms. Burns happens to be in the FOSO at this point, Court allows Joy to withdraw from the case, continues bond, set for AIA on both cases.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:26 PM. Also called 15CM04. Herrera states he does not have either complaint. Court reads charges and penalties for both cases and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Herrera understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, believes he is eligible for SPD. Court sets for AIA. Herrera asks for signature bond for stated reasons (warrants in Shawano and Milwaukee County). State - bond - significant cash bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - 15CM04 - $1000 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol. Court - bond - 15CM38 - continues bond of $500 cash and set for same date and time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:45 am.
No consumption of alcohol. - Refused to sign.
